DOC.HEAD: Three Killed In Police Chase Crash
DOC.TEXT: A speeding car driven by a man trying to elude state troopers slammed head-on into another car on an expressway Sunday, killing three women and critically injuring the man, police said. Robert L. Harrison, 30, of Youngstown sped the wrong way on the city expressway for about three-fourths of a mile before the collision around 1 p.m., police said. Harrison was believed to have snatched a purse at a supermarket in nearby Girard, then escaped in what police believe was a stolen car, said Girard Police Capt. Dominic Petrarca. A patrolman gave chase after seeing the car run a red light, Petrarca said. Harrison eluded the police car. But when he spotted a state Highway Patrol cruiser on Interstate 680 later, he headed eastbound onto the westbound lane of the expressway, the captain said. The victims were pronounced dead at the scene. Their identities were being withheld pending notification of relatives, officials said. Harrison was listed in critical condition Sunday night at Saint Elizabeth Hospital Medical Center in Youngstown. An officer who answered the phone at the Girard police department Sunday night refused to say whether charges had been filed against Harrison. He refused to give his name.
